content.question: Which of the following explain the effects of different party system between two countries studied in the AP Comparative Government and Politics course?

choices.label: In the United Kingdom, single-member plurality districts have created a two-party system, whereas in Iran formal political parties do not exist.
In Russia, the domination of one party leads to stable political leadership, whereas in China multiple parties have created a complex and competitive party system.
In Mexico, a two-party system has emerged from single-member districts, whereas in Nigeria a proportional system has created a dominant party system.
In Iran, a dominant party system is enshrined in the constitution, whereas in Nigeria thresholds are used to limit the number of political parties.

content.answer: In the United Kingdom, single-member plurality districts have created a two-party system, whereas in Iran formal political parties do not exist.

unit.text: 4: Party and Electoral Systems and Citizen Organizations
